public final class Database extends Object

  • Method Details

    • writeLine

      public static void writeLine(String csvName, String[] line) throws IOException
      WriteLine simply writes a line to the CSV. It assumes that you know what you are doing and doesn't check for PK violation.
      Parameters:
      csvName - "Reservation.csv" or wtv
      line - line format = {"2", "2021-10-13","2000","5", "Ryan", "995", "8"}; = String[] type
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readAll

      public static ArrayList<HashMap<String,String>> readAll(String csvName) throws CsvException, IOException
      Parameters:
      csvName - The name of the CSV. Pulls all data from a CSV.
      Returns:
      An arraylist of hashmaps for all of the values in the CSV
      Throws:
      CsvException - if csv exception
      IOException - if fileio exception

    • updateLine

      public static boolean updateLine(String csvName, String primaryKey, String[] line) throws IOException, CsvException
      Assumes you know what you are doing and PKs are unique. Finds PK, removes it and rewrites the whole CSV. (inefficient i know)
      Parameters:
      csvName - name of csv file
      primaryKey - pk
      line - line to write format = {"2", "2021-10-13","2000","5", "Ryan", "995", "8"}; = String[] type
      Returns:
      whether updated or not
      Throws:
      IOException - File IO Exception
      CsvException - CSV Exception

    • removeLine

      public static Boolean removeLine(String csvName, String primaryKey) throws IOException, CsvValidationException
      Essentially the same code as update, however, it doesn't "modify" anything
      Parameters:
      csvName - csvName
      primaryKey - pk
      Returns:
      whether or not successfully removed
      Throws:
      IOException - file io exception
      CsvValidationException - csv exception

    • WriteToJsonFile

      public static void WriteToJsonFile(Object obj, String filepath) throws IOException
      The only method to write to JSON format text file You can pass any type of class in this method, With your own desired file path, and this method will save nice json format for you Usage:: Database.WriteToJsonFile(menu,"csv/menu.json")
      Parameters:
      obj - an type of object
      filepath - the path where json file located at.
      Throws:
      IOException - to ensure the file is save

    • LoadFromJsonFile

      public static Map LoadFromJsonFile(String filepath) throws IOException
      pass in file name and the file must be exist before you read You can choose to write empty object to the file by calling WriteToJsonFile method above Usage:: Database.readFromJsonFile("csv/menu.json")
      Parameters:
      filepath - the path where json file located at.
      Throws:
      IOException - to ensure the file is save
